name: Elementwise m * x^a * y^b
description: Returns product of powers m⋅xayb (multiplied by m parameter). Second argument y is optional: if it is skipped, performs single power operation m⋅xa.

in_ports.name: y
in_ports.hint: [Optional] Ignored if skipped (function returns m * x^a)

controls.name: b
controls.description: Note: here and in the previous parameter you can use either a usual real number, or a special string "A / B", where A and B are any real numbers (spaces are ignored). The last form means usual division A/B. It can be convenient, for example, for values like 1/3, that cannot be written exactly as a decimal numbers.

controls.caption: First X column
controls.description: First index of number in the blocks of the array X
controls.name: indexInBlockX

controls.caption: First Y column
controls.description: First index of number in the blocks of the array Y
controls.name: indexInBlockY

controls.caption: Number of processed columns
controls.description: Length of processed part in each block of both arrays; if 0, all arrays are processed and indexes above are ignored
controls.name: lengthInBlock

controls.caption: Replace processed columns
controls.description: Replace processed part in array X with the result and return corrected X
controls.name: replaceColumnRangeInInput
